abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Toot Oil and
            Gas Development Project for Pakistan was unsatisfactory. The
            project failed to achieve its production objectives, its
            impact has been modest, sustainability is uncertain at this
            time, and the performance of the Bank was satisfactory while
            the Borrower's was mixed. Two main lessons can be
            learned from this project. First, the OGDC (Oil and Gas
            Development Company) needs to establish a financial
            management system satisfactory to the Bank in order to
            handle accounts properly. Second, the Bank's assumption
            about the outcome of the project was overly optimistic. The
            failure rate of the project was much higher than expected.
            In the future, the Bank needs to take into account all of
            the risks and possible outcomes of a project. This will
            allow the Bank to be prepared for and able to handle
            unexpected outcomes when they arise.
